abstract: Shares in Germany’s Commerzbank, which has been persistently cited as a possible takeover target, jumped more than 3 percent on Tuesday to near a seven-year peak on market talk that Citigroup was likely to bid about 45 euros ($61) per share for the bank, traders said.
lead_paragraph: Shares in Germany’s Commerzbank, which has been persistently cited as a possible takeover target, jumped more than 3 percent on Tuesday to near a seven-year peak on market talk that Citigroup was likely to bid about 45 euros ($61) per share for the bank, traders said.

headline.main: Commerzbank Jumps on Rumors of a Citigroup Deal
